abstract: Shares of UST, which makes the smokeless tobacco brands Skoal and Copenhagen, surged 24 percent after the opening bell on Friday. Investors were reacting to a report in The New York Times, which said the company was in talks to be acquired by Altria for more than $10 billion.
lead_paragraph: Shares of UST, which makes the smokeless tobacco brands Skoal and Copenhagen, surged 24 percent after the opening bell on Friday. Investors were reacting to a report in The New York Times, which said the company was in talks to be acquired by Altria for more than $10 billion.

headline.main: UST’s Shares Catch Fire After Report of Deal Talks
